alert.note: Alert for Eastern Panhandle, Crescent Lake NWR; Frenchman Basin; Loess Plains; Niobrara Valley, Fort Niobrara NWR, Samuel R McKelvie National Forest; Sandhills, Valentine NWR, Nebraska National Forest (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 02 at 2:58AM CDT until August 03 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...THUNDERSTORMS WITH DRY LIGHTNING HEADING FOR WESTERN NEBRASKA... .Intense daytime heating and the arrival of subtropical moisture aloft this afternoon and tonight will lead to the development of scattered high based thunderstorms. Some storms will produce little or no rainfall and occasional cloud to ground lightning. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM CDT /3 PM MDT/ THIS AFTERNOON TO 4 AM CDT /3 AM MDT/ WEDNESDAY FOR THUNDERSTORMS FOR THE EASTERN PANHANDLE/CRESCENT LAKE NWR, THE SANDHILLS/VALENTINE NWR/THE NEBRASKA NATIONAL FOREST, THE NIOBRARA VALLEY/FORT NIOBRARA NWR/SAMUEL R MCKELVIE NATIONAL FOREST, FRENCHMAN BASIN, THE LOESS PLAINS... The National Weather Service in North Platte has issued a Red Flag Warning FOR THUNDERSTORMS, which is in effect from 4 PM CDT /3 PM MDT/ this afternoon to 4 AM CDT /3 AM MDT/ Wednesday. * Affected Area...In NEZ204...Fire Weather Zone 204 Eastern Panhandle/Crescent Lake NWR. In NEZ206...Fire Weather Zone 206 Sandhills/Valentine NWR/Nebraska National Forest. In NEZ208... Fire Weather Zone 208 Niobrara Valley/Fort Niobrara NWR/Samuel R McKelvie National Forest. In NEZ210...Fire Weather Zone 210 Frenchman Basin. In NEZ219...Fire Weather Zone 219 Loess Plains. * Impacts...Scattered thunderstorms will develop this afternoon and tonight, with most of them being dry. The expected lightning with little rain should increase the number of wildfire starts. * Thunderstorms...Commence in the Panhandle late this afternoon and develop east through the Sandhills and southwest Nebraska during the evening. The thunderstorm activity may last past midnight. * Outflow Winds...Thunderstorms will be capable of gusts to 50 mph.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Panhandle, Crescent Lake NWR; Frenchman Basin; Loess Plains; Niobrara Valley, Fort Niobrara NWR, Samuel R McKelvie National Forest; Sandhills, Valentine NWR, Nebraska National Forest
